meanings.definition: The quality or state of being temperate.
meanings.sent1: Her temperatenesses in eating helped her maintain a healthy weight.
meanings.sent2: The temperatenesses of the climate made it a pleasant place to live.
meanings.sent3: His temperatenesses in spending money always amazed his friends.
meanings.sent4: The temperatenesses of her voice made her a soothing presence in the room.
meanings.sent5: The temperatenesses of the colors in the painting created a harmonious effect.

meanings.definition: Moderation or self-restraint in action or statement.
meanings.sent1: The politician's temperatenesses in his speeches earned him respect from both sides.
meanings.sent2: She showed great temperatenesses in not reacting to the rude comments.
meanings.sent3: His temperatenesses in eating cake were put to the test at the party.
meanings.sent4: The temperatenesses of her laughter during the serious meeting was quite noticeable.
meanings.sent5: The temperatenesses of his pace during the race helped him conserve energy for the final sprint.
